member.name: T:MRI_Core_Library.CoreLegacyModule
member.summary:
Modern Robotics Part Number 45-2202 - Core Legacy Module
An instance of this class is needed before any Legacy Devices can be initialized.

code.source: I:\Visual Studio\Projects\MRI Core Library Examples\Ex Legacy Module - Analog\Program.cs
code.title: Analog

code.source: I:\Visual Studio\Projects\MRI Core Library Examples\Ex Legacy Module - Ultrasonic\Program.cs
code.title: Ultrasonic

code.source: I:\Visual Studio\Projects\MRI Core Library Examples\Ex Legacy Module - Matrix\Program.cs
code.title: Matrix Controller

member.name: M:MRI_Core_Library.CoreLegacyModule.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary:
Initialize this class using a COM port (ex "COM9") or serial number (ex "AI9UJGW4")
If you do not know the COM port, use Core_Control_Module.printConnectedDevices() or Core Device Discovery.
This function will open communication to the module.

member.name: M:MRI_Core_Library.CoreLegacyModule.#ctor
member.summary: Initialize the first available Legacy Module the computer can find. If being used with ofther constructors that specify a COM Port or Serial Number, use those first.

member.name: M:MRI_Core_Library.CoreLegacyModule.setLEDs(System.Byte)
member.summary: Sets the state for four LEDs on the left side of the legacy module. From bottom to top, the LEDs are controlled by bits 0-1-3-2.

member.name: M:MRI_Core_Library.CoreLegacyModule.setControlPins(System.Int32,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary:
Control Pins supply voltage to analog sensors like the LEGO light sensor.
This function turns off I2C Mode and turns off 9V mode.

member.name: M:MRI_Core_Library.CoreLegacyModule.readAnalog(System.Int32)
member.summary: Reads the analog value of a port

member.name: M:MRI_Core_Library.CoreLegacyModule.readI2C(System.Int32,System.Byte,System.Byte,System.Byte,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Reads an I2C sensor. The I2C address of the sensor must be known. The requested data starts at index 4 of the returned array.
member.param: Register on the sensor to start reading from
Supply 9Volts to sensor. Only applicale on ports 4 and 5. For use with Ultrasonic.
member.returns: Byte[] {mode, I2C addr, register on the sensor the payload came from, length of data, 27 bytes of data, flag (should be 0x00)

member.name: M:MRI_Core_Library.CoreLegacyModule.readI2C(System.Int32,System.Byte,System.Byte)
member.summary: Reads one byte from an I2C sensor
member.param: Register of the senaor to read

member.name: M:MRI_Core_Library.CoreLegacyModule.writeI2C(System.Int32,System.Byte,System.Byte,System.Byte[],System.Boolean)
member.summary: Writes a string of bytes to a I2C device connected to the Legacy Module
member.param: Register of which to start the write
Byte array to write starting at reg
True of this device requires 9V instead of 5

member.name: T:MRI_Core_Library.CoreDeviceInterface
member.summary:
Modern Robotics Part Number 45-2201 - Core Device Interface
An instance of this class is needed before any sensors can be initialized.

member.name: M:MRI_Core_Library.CoreDeviceInterface.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary:
Initialize this class using a COM port or Serial Number. ex "COM9" or "AI02RHRK".
If you do not know the COM port, use Core_Control_Module.printConnectedDevices() or Core Device Discovery.
This function will open communication to the module.

member.name: M:MRI_Core_Library.CoreDeviceInterface.#ctor
member.summary: Initialize the first available Core Device Interface the computer can find. If being used with ofther constructors that specify a COM Port or Serial Number, use those first.

member.name: T:MRI_Core_Library.CoreDeviceInterface.LEDstate
member.summary: LEDs combinations on Core Device Interface assigned to their value

member.name: M:MRI_Core_Library.CoreDeviceInterface.setLEDs(MRI_Core_Library.CoreDeviceInterface.LEDstate)
member.summary: This function controlls the red and blue LEDs on the top of the Core Device Interface.

member.name: M:MRI_Core_Library.CoreDeviceInterface.getLEDs
member.summary: Returns the current state of the RED and BLUE LEDs

member.name: M:MRI_Core_Library.CoreDeviceInterface.readAnalog(System.Byte)
member.summary: Returns a number between 0 and 1023 representing no voltage to full voltage. Ports are 0-7.

member.name: M:MRI_Core_Library.CoreDeviceInterface.readAllAnalog
member.summary: Returns an int[8] with 8 analog readings from 0 to 1023. Index corresponds to port number.

member.name: M:MRI_Core_Library.CoreDeviceInterface.readDigital8
member.summary:
Returns a byte carrying the state of all digital ports. The desired digital ports must be in input mode (default).
Each bit of the byte is the state of the input. bit0 = 1 means D0 is high. bit6=0 means D6 is low.

member.name: M:MRI_Core_Library.CoreDeviceInterface.readDigital(System.Byte)
member.summary: Returns true if the digital port is high.

member.name: M:MRI_Core_Library.CoreDeviceInterface.setDIOcontrol(System.Byte)
member.summary:
This byte sets all digital ports to either input or output. Each bit corresponds to a digital port. 0 is input. 1 is output.
0b11110000 will set D0-D3 to input and D4-D7 to output.
This method does not turn on any digital ports. After using this method, see setDigitalOut() to turn ports on.

member.name: M:MRI_Core_Library.CoreDeviceInterface.getDIOcontrol
member.summary: See setDIOcontrol()
member.returns: Returns current input/output state of Digital ports

member.name: M:MRI_Core_Library.CoreDeviceInterface.setDigitalOut(System.Byte)
member.summary:
After setting port(s) to output mode using setDIOcontrol(), output ports can be turned on using this method.
Each bit in the byte corresponds to a digital port. 1 is on and 0 is off.

member.name: M:MRI_Core_Library.CoreDeviceInterface.getDOut
member.summary: See setDigitalOut()

member.name: M:MRI_Core_Library.CoreDeviceInterface.writeI2C(System.Byte,System.Byte,System.Byte[],System.Byte)
member.summary: Writes a byte array to an I2C sensor. Max 27. The port in which the sensor is connected does not matter.
member.param: Address of the sensor to talk to. Use list_I2C_devices() to find I2C addresses of connected sensors.
Location in sensor to start writing data.
Byte array to write to sensor.
Buffer of Core Device Interface to use. Accepts 0-5.

member.name: M:MRI_Core_Library.CoreDeviceInterface.readI2C(System.Byte,System.Byte,System.Int32,System.Byte)
member.summary:
Reads an array of bytes from I2C Sensor. Max 27. The port in which the sensor is connected does not matter.
This method requests data from the sensor, then continually reads from the Core Device Interface until the Core Device Interface sets the flag to done.
Note that the requested data does not start at index 0. Your requested data will start at index 4.
member.param: Location in the sensor to begin reading
Buffer of Core Device Interface to use. Accepts 0-5.
member.returns: Returns a byte array containing {Read/Write (0x80/0x00), I2CAddress, Sensor Start Register, Length of data, 27 bytes of data, Flag (0x00 represents good data)}

member.name: T:MRI_Core_Library.CoreDeviceInterface.analogOutMode
member.summary: List of Analog Out modes corresponding to their values

member.name: F:MRI_Core_Library.CoreDeviceInterface.analogOutMode.Voltage
member.summary: Constant Voltage

member.name: F:MRI_Core_Library.CoreDeviceInterface.analogOutMode.Sine
member.summary: Sine Wave Output

member.name: F:MRI_Core_Library.CoreDeviceInterface.analogOutMode.Square
member.summary: Square Wave Output

member.name: F:MRI_Core_Library.CoreDeviceInterface.analogOutMode.Triange
member.summary: Triangle Wave Output

member.name: M:MRI_Core_Library.CoreDeviceInterface.setAnalogOut(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,MRI_Core_Library.CoreDeviceInterface.analogOutMode)
member.summary:
Controls an analog out Port. This method is all inclusive.
If mode is set to Voltage, Frequency is also set to 0.

member.name: M:MRI_Core_Library.CoreDeviceInterface.setAnalogOutVoltage(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets voltage only of Analog Out Port. See setAnalogOut()

member.name: M:MRI_Core_Library.CoreDeviceInterface.setAnalogOutFrequency(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Sets frequency only of Analog Out Port.
If mode is set to Voltage, Frequency is also set to 0.
See setAnalogOut()

member.name: M:MRI_Core_Library.CoreDeviceInterface.setAnalogOutMode(System.Int32,MRI_Core_Library.CoreDeviceInterface.analogOutMode)
member.summary:
Sets mode only of Analog Out Port.
If mode is set to Voltage, Frequency is also set to 0.

member.name: M:MRI_Core_Library.CoreDeviceInterface.getAnalogOutMode(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets Analog Output Mode

member.name: M:MRI_Core_Library.CoreDeviceInterface.setPWM(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets PWM settings for one PWM port. This function is all inclusive for the PWM port. Both values are unsigned words (16 bit)
member.param: On time in units of micro seconds
Period in units of micro seconds

member.name: M:MRI_Core_Library.CoreDeviceInterface.setPWMonTime(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets on time for one PWM port.
member.param: On time in units of micro seconds. 16 bit

member.name: M:MRI_Core_Library.CoreDeviceInterface.setPWMperiod(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets period for one PWM port
member.param: Period in units of micro seconds. 16 bit

member.name: T:MRI_Core_Library.CoreDeviceInterface.sensorType
member.summary: Types of I2C Sensors and their IDs

member.name: F:MRI_Core_Library.CoreDeviceInterface.sensorType.unknown
member.summary: Default

member.name: M:MRI_Core_Library.CoreDeviceInterface.getSensorType(System.Byte)
member.summary: Returns the type of I2C Sensor at a particular I2C Address

member.name: M:MRI_Core_Library.CoreDeviceInterface.printI2CDevices
member.summary:
Writes I2C devices to the Console with their I2C Address and verisons in hex.
This function utilizes findI2CDevices()

member.name: M:MRI_Core_Library.CoreDeviceInterface.findI2CDevices
member.summary:
Reads registers 0-3 for all possible I2C addresses. If register 0x00 does not equal 0xFF, these three registers are loged in the array.
In MR sensors, these registers represent Version, Manufacturer, and ID

member.name: T:MRI_Core_Library.AnalogIn
member.summary: Class for an analog device. Core_Device_Interface instance must be created before instatiating this class.

member.name: F:MRI_Core_Library.AnalogIn.module
member.summary: Module to which the device is connected to

member.name: M:MRI_Core_Library.AnalogIn.#ctor(System.Byte,MRI_Core_Library.CoreDeviceInterface)
member.summary: Initiate the device by specifying a port and module the device is connected to.

member.name: M:MRI_Core_Library.AnalogIn.read
member.summary: Value of analog sensor

member.name: T:MRI_Core_Library.DigitalIO
member.summary: Class for a digital device like a switch. Core_Device_Interface instance must be created before instatiating this class.

member.name: F:MRI_Core_Library.DigitalIO.module
member.summary: Module to which the device is connected to

member.name: M:MRI_Core_Library.DigitalIO.#ctor(System.Byte,MRI_Core_Library.CoreDeviceInterface)
member.summary: Initiate the device by specifying a port and module the device is connected to.

member.name: M:MRI_Core_Library.DigitalIO.read
member.summary: Reading of this digital device
member.returns: True for high. False for low

member.name: M:MRI_Core_Library.DigitalIO.input
member.summary: Sets port to input. By default all digital ports are input.

member.name: M:MRI_Core_Library.DigitalIO.output
member.summary: Sets port to output. By default all digital ports are input.

member.name: M:MRI_Core_Library.DigitalIO.isOutput
member.summary: Checks if port is in output mode
member.returns: True is port is in output mode. False if in input mode.

member.name: M:MRI_Core_Library.DigitalIO.off
member.summary: If the port is in output mode, this function will turn the port off. By default, the port is off.

member.name: M:MRI_Core_Library.DigitalIO.on
member.summary: If the port is in output mode, this function will turn the port on.

member.name: M:MRI_Core_Library.DigitalIO.isOn
member.summary: Checks to see if the port is on. This method may return true even if the port is set to input mode.
member.returns: True is the port is on.

member.name: T:MRI_Core_Library.I2CDevice
member.summary:
A general I2CDevice. Core_Device_Interface instance must be created before instatiating this class.
Modern Robotics Sensor have or will recieve their own class with specialized methods.
All other I2C Sensor classes like the Modern Robotics Color Sensor will inherit this class.

code.source: I:\Visual Studio\Projects\MRI Core Library Examples\Ex List I2C Devices\Program.cs

member.name: F:MRI_Core_Library.I2CDevice.module
member.summary: Module to which the device is connected to

member.name: M:MRI_Core_Library.I2CDevice.#ctor(System.Byte,MRI_Core_Library.CoreDeviceInterface)
member.summary: Initialize the I2CDevice instance using the I2C address and the module the sensor is connected to. The port at which the sensor is connected does not matter.

member.name: M:MRI_Core_Library.I2CDevice.getSensorType
member.summary: Returns the name of the sensor at this address.

member.name: M:MRI_Core_Library.I2CDevice.getI2CAddr
member.summary: Returns the I2C address of this instance.

member.name: M:MRI_Core_Library.I2CDevice.setI2CAddr(System.Byte)
member.summary: The I2C address of an I2C device is set during initialization although it can be changed here.

member.name: M:MRI_Core_Library.I2CDevice.read(System.Byte,System.Int32)
member.summary: Reads an array of registers from the instanciated I2CDevice. This function only returns the data as opposed to the readI2C function in the Core_Device_Interface_Class. A parameter length of 5 will return a byte[] of length 5.
member.param: Number of consecuitive bytes to read

member.name: M:MRI_Core_Library.I2CDevice.read(System.Byte)
member.summary: Reads only one byte.

member.name: M:MRI_Core_Library.I2CDevice.readLsbMsb(System.Byte)
member.summary:
Reads two bytes and combines then as lbs/msb to create one signed int.
-32,768 to 32,767

member.name: M:MRI_Core_Library.I2CDevice.writeLsbMsb(System.Byte,System.Int32)
member.summary: Writes an integer as an LSB and MSB

member.name: M:MRI_Core_Library.I2CDevice.readFsbMsb(System.Byte)
member.summary:
Reads a decimal number where the first byte is the decemals and the second byte is the whole numbers.
For example, 0b 0000 0001 1000 0000 would return 1.5.

member.name: M:MRI_Core_Library.I2CDevice.writeFsbMsb(System.Byte,System.Double)
member.summary: Writes a decimal number with decimals in the first byte and the whole numbers in the second byte.

member.name: M:MRI_Core_Library.I2CDevice.write(System.Byte,System.Byte[])
member.summary: Writes a byte array to an I2C Sensor starting at the specified register. The byte array shouldbe the exact size of the data you want to write. Index 0 will go in the register specified. Index 1 will go into the following register and so on.

member.name: M:MRI_Core_Library.I2CDevice.write(System.Byte,System.Byte)
member.summary: Write one byte to the sensor at the specified register.

member.name: M:MRI_Core_Library.I2CDevice.firmwareRevision
member.summary: Get the version number of the sensor.
member.returns: Version followed by a decimal and the revision.

member.summary: Set all parameters for this port If mode is set to Voltage, Frequency is also set to 0.

member.summary: Mode of this AnalogOut device

member.name: T:MRI_Core_Library.PWMOut
member.summary:
A PWM port on the Core Device Interface
Note that the PWM ports do not have enough current to power a standard size servo. Current limit of 22mA

member.name: F:MRI_Core_Library.PWMOut.module
member.summary: Mode the PWM device is connected to

member.name: M:MRI_Core_Library.PWMOut.#ctor(System.Int32,MRI_Core_Library.CoreDeviceInterface)
member.summary: Initialize the PWM device. An instance of Core_Device_Interface must be created first.

member.name: M:MRI_Core_Library.PWMOut.set(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets PWM settings for this PWM port. This function is all inclusive for the PWM port. Both values are unsigned words (16 bit)
member.param: On Time in units of micro seconds
Period in units of micro seconds

member.name: M:MRI_Core_Library.PWMOut.setOnTime(System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets on time for this port.
member.param: On time in units of micro seconds. 16 bit

member.name: M:MRI_Core_Library.PWMOut.setPeriod(System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets period for this port.
member.param: Period in units of micro seconds. 16 bit

member.name: M:MRI_Core_Library.PWMOut.setServo(System.Int32)
member.summary:
Recommended function for using a small servo on a PWM port. This function sets the period to the reccomended value of 20,000. 750 is added to position before sending the position to the on time.
Note that the PWM ports do not have enough current to power a standard size servo. Current limit of 22mA

member.name: M:MRI_Core_Library.PWMOut.disable
member.summary:
Turns the port off.
This function simply calls set(0, 0)

member.name: T:MRI_Core_Library.CoreMotorController
member.summary:
Modern Robotics Part Number 45-2203 - Core Motor Controller
An instance of this class is needed before any motors can be initialized.

member.name: T:MRI_Core_Library.CoreMotorController.mode
member.summary: Modes of the motor channels

member.name: M:MRI_Core_Library.CoreMotorController.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary:
Initialize this class using a COM port (ex "COM9") or serial number (ex "AI9UJGW4")
If you do not know the COM port, use Core_Control_Module.printConnectedDevices() or Core Device Discovery.
This function will open communication to the module and start the watchdog.

member.name: M:MRI_Core_Library.CoreMotorController.#ctor
member.summary: Initialize the first available Motor Controller the computer can find. If being used with ofther constructors that specify a COM Port or Serial Number, use those first.

member.name: M:MRI_Core_Library.CoreMotorController.startWatchDog
member.summary:
The motor controller will stop both motors if it does not recieve any communication for 2.5 seconds.
This method starts a thread which will ping the motor controller every second if no communication has not been sent for one second.
This method is called when the Motor Controller is initialized

member.name: M:MRI_Core_Library.CoreMotorController.stopWatchDog
member.summary:
See startWatchDog()
This method stops the watchdog so the controller will stop 2.5 seconds after the last communication was sent.
At least call this method at the end of your program.

member.name: M:MRI_Core_Library.CoreMotorController.setTargetPosition(System.Int32,System.Int64)
member.summary: Set the Target Postion for a motor. This value is used only in Run To Position mode.
member.param: Target encoder position signed 32 bit value

member.name: M:MRI_Core_Library.CoreMotorController.setMode(System.Int32,MRI_Core_Library.CoreMotorController.mode)
member.summary:
Set the mode of a motor channel.
See product page or modernroboticsedu.com for more information
If Core_Motor_Controller.mode.Stop_And_Reset_Encoder is used, the motor controller will reset to Core_Motor_Controller.mode.Constant_Power after completion

member.name: M:MRI_Core_Library.CoreMotorController.setPower(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Set the power of the motor. This is used in all three runnning modes of the motor.
100 should be clockwise. -100 counterclockwise. 0 is stop.

member.name: M:MRI_Core_Library.CoreMotorController.getPosition(System.Int32)
member.summary:
Current encoder position of a motor.
Encoder posiiton only resets if the motor controller is powered off or if the mode Core_Motor_Controller.mode.Stop_And_Reset_Encoder is set.
Encoder value should increase as motor turns clockwise.

member.name: M:MRI_Core_Library.CoreMotorController.getTargetPosition(System.Int32)
member.summary: See setTargetPosition()

member.name: M:MRI_Core_Library.CoreMotorController.getBatteryVoltage
member.summary: Returns voltage of power input.

member.name: M:MRI_Core_Library.CoreMotorController.getPower(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets a motor power from controller

member.name: M:MRI_Core_Library.CoreMotorController.getMode(System.Int32)
member.summary: Get the current mode of a channel

member.name: M:MRI_Core_Library.CoreMotorController.distanceToTarget(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets the target and position from the controller and returns the distance left to travel

member.name: T:MRI_Core_Library.Motor
member.summary: A motor connected to a Core Motor Controller. An instance of Core_Motor_Controller must be created first.

code.source: I:\Visual Studio\Projects\MRI Core Library Examples\Ex Motor\Program.cs

member.name: F:MRI_Core_Library.Motor.module
member.summary: Core_Motor_Controller this motor is connected to

member.name: M:MRI_Core_Library.Motor.#ctor(System.Int32,MRI_Core_Library.CoreMotorController)
member.summary: Initialize a motor. An instance of Core_Motor_Controller must be created first

member.name: M:MRI_Core_Library.Motor.setTargetPosition(System.Int64)
member.summary: Set the Target Postion for this motor. This value is used only in Run To Position mode.
member.param: Target encoder position signed 32 bit value

member.name: M:MRI_Core_Library.Motor.setMode(MRI_Core_Library.CoreMotorController.mode)
member.summary:
Set the mode of this motor
See product page or modernroboticsedu.com for more information
If Core_Motor_Controller.mode.Stop_And_Reset_Encoder is used, the motor controller will reset to Core_Motor_Controller.mode.Constant_Power after completion

member.name: M:MRI_Core_Library.Motor.setPower(System.Int32)
member.summary:
Set the power of this motor. This is used in all three runnning modes of the motor.
100 should be clockwise. -100 counterclockwise. 0 is stop.

member.name: M:MRI_Core_Library.Motor.getPosition
member.summary:
Current encoder position of this motor.
Encoder posiiton only resets if the motor controller is powered off or if the mode Core_Motor_Controller.mode.Stop_And_Reset_Encoder is set.
Encoder value should increase as motor turns clockwise.

member.name: M:MRI_Core_Library.Motor.getTargetPosition
member.summary: See setTargetPosition()

member.name: M:MRI_Core_Library.Motor.getPower
member.summary: Gets the motor power from controller

member.name: M:MRI_Core_Library.Motor.distanceToTarget
member.summary: Gets the target and position from the controller and returns the distance left to travel

member.name: M:MRI_Core_Library.Motor.getMode
member.summary: Get the current mode of a channel

member.name: T:MRI_Core_Library.CoreServoController
member.summary:
Modern Robotics Part Number 45-2204 - Core Servo Controller
An instance of this class is needed before any servos can be initialized.

member.name: M:MRI_Core_Library.CoreServoController.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary:
Initialize this class using a COM port (ex "COM9") or serial number (ex "AI9UJGW4")
If you do not know the COM port, use Core_Control_Module.printConnectedDevices() or Core Device Discovery.
This function will open communication to the module.
This function does not enable the servos. See enable()

member.name: M:MRI_Core_Library.CoreServoController.#ctor
member.summary: Initialize the first available Servo Controller the computer can find. If being used with ofther constructors that specify a COM Port or Serial Number, use those first.

member.name: M:MRI_Core_Library.CoreServoController.setPositions(System.Byte[])
member.summary:
Set up to 6 servo positions most efficiently.
This function starts by setting the position for channel 1 and continues for the length of the byte[]
Servo positions are 0-255 or 0x00-0xFF
This function does not enable the servos. See enable()

member.name: M:MRI_Core_Library.CoreServoController.getPositions
member.summary:
See setPositions()
Returns the positions set by the user.
There is no feedback form the servos to the controller. These values only represent the desired positions.

member.name: M:MRI_Core_Library.CoreServoController.setPosition(System.Int32,System.Byte)
member.summary:
Set a single position from 0-255
This function does not enable the servos. See enable()

member.name: M:MRI_Core_Library.CoreServoController.getPosition(System.Int32)
member.summary:
See getPositions()
Returns a desired position of one servo. This is not the physical position the servo is at as there is no feedback from the servo.

member.name: M:MRI_Core_Library.CoreServoController.enable
member.summary:
Enables all servo channels.
If no communication is sent to controller for 10 seconds, all channels will be disabled.

member.name: M:MRI_Core_Library.CoreServoController.disable
member.summary: Disables all servo channels.

member.name: M:MRI_Core_Library.CoreServoController.enableWithoutTimeout
member.summary: Enables all servo channels with disregard to the 10 second timeout

member.name: M:MRI_Core_Library.CoreServoController.isDisabled
member.summary: Check if servo channels are disabled

member.name: T:MRI_Core_Library.Servo
member.summary: A servo connected to a Core Servo Controller. An instance of Core_Servo_Controller must be created first.

code.source: I:/Visual Studio/Projects/MRI Core Library Examples/Ex Servo/Program.cs

member.name: M:MRI_Core_Library.Servo.#ctor(System.Int32,MRI_Core_Library.CoreServoController)
member.summary:
Initialize a servo on a controller port
An instance of Core_Servo_Controller must be created first.
This function does not enable the servos. See enableAll()

member.name: M:MRI_Core_Library.Servo.setPosition(System.Byte)
member.summary: This function does not enable the servos. See enableAll()

member.name: M:MRI_Core_Library.Servo.setPosition(System.Int32)
member.summary: This function does not enable the servos. See enableAll()

member.name: M:MRI_Core_Library.Servo.enableAll
member.summary:
Enables all servos on the host controller.
If controller recieves no communication for 10 seconds, all servos will be disabled.

member.name: M:MRI_Core_Library.Servo.disableAll
member.summary: Disables all servos on controller.

member.name: T:MRI_Core_Library.ColorSensor
member.summary:
Modern Robotics Part Number 45-2018 - Color Sensor
Extends I2CDevice. Adds functions specific to the Modern Robotics Color Sensor
An instance of Core_Device_Interface must be created first.

member.name: T:MRI_Core_Library.ColorSensor.mode
member.summary: Mode of the color sensor. To learn about modes, go to Modern Robotics Edu

member.name: F:MRI_Core_Library.ColorSensor.mode.Active
member.summary: Uses a flashing LED to filter out ambiant light. Good for reading reflected light like the color of objects.

member.name: F:MRI_Core_Library.ColorSensor.mode.Passive
member.summary: Does not use the LED. This mode will detect the color of ambiant light

member.name: F:MRI_Core_Library.ColorSensor.mode.Frequency50Hz
member.summary: For countries that use a 50Hz electrical grid.

member.name: F:MRI_Core_Library.ColorSensor.mode.Frequency60Hz
member.summary: For countries that use a 60Hz electrical grid (USA and others)

member.name: F:MRI_Core_Library.ColorSensor.mode.BlackLevelCalibration
member.summary: Reference Sensor Documentation.

member.name: F:MRI_Core_Library.ColorSensor.mode.WhiteLevelCalibration
member.summary: Reference Sensor Documentation.

member.name: M:MRI_Core_Library.ColorSensor.#ctor(MRI_Core_Library.CoreDeviceInterface)
member.summary:
Initializes a Color Sensor on a Core Device Interface. Port does not matter.
This method assumes the color sensor has the factory default address of 0x3C

member.name: M:MRI_Core_Library.ColorSensor.#ctor(System.Byte,MRI_Core_Library.CoreDeviceInterface)
member.summary: Initializes a Color Sensor on a Core Device Interface with a non-default address. Port does not matter.

member.name: M:MRI_Core_Library.ColorSensor.setMode(MRI_Core_Library.ColorSensor.mode)
member.summary: Sets the mode of the color sensor. See Color_Sensor.mode

member.name: M:MRI_Core_Library.ColorSensor.getMode
member.summary: Returns mode of sensor. See ColorSensor.mode

member.name: M:MRI_Core_Library.ColorSensor.colorNumber
member.summary:
Most simplistic way to use the color sensor.
The color number register returns a single number representing the color estimate.
The number corresponds to the diagram on the Color Sensor Product Page.
member.returns: Color from 0-16 representing a section of the color spectrum.

member.name: M:MRI_Core_Library.ColorSensor.red
member.summary:
The color values are returned separately as red, green, blue and white.
The color value is a measure of the current detection levels for each primary color.

member.name: M:MRI_Core_Library.ColorSensor.green
member.summary:
The color values are returned separately as red, green, blue and white.
The color value is a measure of the current detection levels for each primary color.

member.name: M:MRI_Core_Library.ColorSensor.blue
member.summary:
The color values are returned separately as red, green, blue and white.
The color value is a measure of the current detection levels for each primary color.

member.name: M:MRI_Core_Library.ColorSensor.white
member.summary:
The color values are returned separately as red, green, blue and white.
The color value is a measure of the current detection levels for each primary color.

member.name: M:MRI_Core_Library.ColorSensor.colorIndexNumber
member.summary:
The color index number is a single 6 bit number.
Bits (5:4) encode the red signal level, bits(3:2) encode the green signal level and bits(1:0) encode the blue signal levels.

member.name: M:MRI_Core_Library.ColorSensor.redIndex
member.summary:
The color index will return the current analog signal levels for red, green and blue separately.
The color with the greatest intensity is set as 0xFF while the other two colors indexes are set as a proportion of 0xFF.

member.name: M:MRI_Core_Library.ColorSensor.greenIndex
member.summary:
The color index will return the current analog signal levels for red, green and blue separately.
The color with the greatest intensity is set as 0xFF while the other two colors indexes are set as a proportion of 0xFF.

member.name: M:MRI_Core_Library.ColorSensor.blueIndex
member.summary:
The color index will return the current analog signal levels for red, green and blue separately.
The color with the greatest intensity is set as 0xFF while the other two colors indexes are set as a proportion of 0xFF.

member.name: M:MRI_Core_Library.ColorSensor.whiteIndex
member.summary:
The color index will return the current analog signal levels for red, green and blue separately.
The color with the greatest intensity is set as 0xFF while the other two colors indexes are set as a proportion of 0xFF.

member.name: M:MRI_Core_Library.ColorSensor.redReading
member.summary: The color reading registers return the current analog signal levels as 16 bits values for red, green, blue and white.

member.name: M:MRI_Core_Library.ColorSensor.greenReading
member.summary: The color reading registers return the current analog signal levels as 16 bits values for red, green, blue and white.

member.name: M:MRI_Core_Library.ColorSensor.blueReading
member.summary: The color reading registers return the current analog signal levels as 16 bits values for red, green, blue and white.

member.name: M:MRI_Core_Library.ColorSensor.whiteReading
member.summary: The color reading registers return the current analog signal levels as 16 bits values for red, green, blue and white.

member.name: M:MRI_Core_Library.ColorSensor.normalizedRedReading
member.summary: The color normalized readings will return the current levels for the color components and white channel that are adjusted for gain and offset.

member.name: M:MRI_Core_Library.ColorSensor.normalizedGreenReading
member.summary: The color normalized readings will return the current levels for the color components and white channel that are adjusted for gain and offset.

member.name: M:MRI_Core_Library.ColorSensor.normalizedBlueReading
member.summary: The color normalized readings will return the current levels for the color components and white channel that are adjusted for gain and offset.

member.name: M:MRI_Core_Library.ColorSensor.normalizedWhiteReading
member.summary: The color normalized readings will return the current levels for the color components and white channel that are adjusted for gain and offset.

member.name: T:MRI_Core_Library.RangeSensor
member.summary:
Modern Robotics Part Number 45-2008 - Range Sensor
Extends I2CDevice. Adds functions specific to the Modern Robotics Range Sensor
An instance of Core_Device_Interface must be created first.

code.source: I:\Visual Studio\Projects\MRI Core Library Examples\Ex Range Sensor\Program.cs

member.name: M:MRI_Core_Library.RangeSensor.#ctor(MRI_Core_Library.CoreDeviceInterface)
member.summary:
Initializes a Range Sensor on a Core Device Interface. Port does not matter.
This method assumes the range sensor has the factory default address of 0x28

member.name: M:MRI_Core_Library.RangeSensor.#ctor(System.Byte,MRI_Core_Library.CoreDeviceInterface)
member.summary: Initializes a Range Sensor on a Core Device Interface with a non-default address. Port does not matter.

member.name: M:MRI_Core_Library.RangeSensor.opticalReading
member.summary: The optical element works by emitting infrared light from on LED and receiving infrared light to the other LED. The optical value can detect objects within 15cm. As an object approaches the optical element the returned value will increase at an exponential rate.

member.name: M:MRI_Core_Library.RangeSensor.ultrasonicReading
member.summary: The ultrasonic element works by one of the transducers emitting a sound wave and the other receiving the sound wave. This reading is accurate between 5cm and approximately 255cm. Since the value returned is in units of centimeters, the return is linear.

member.name: M:MRI_Core_Library.RangeSensor.ultrasonicAndOptical
member.summary: See ultrasonicReading() and opticalReading().

member.name: T:MRI_Core_Library.IntegratingGyro
member.summary:
Modern Robotics Part Number 45-2005 - Integrating Gyro
Extends I2CDevice. Adds functions specific to the Modern Robotics Integrating Gyro
An instance of Core_Device_Interface must be created first.

code.source: I:\Visual Studio\Projects\MRI Core Library Examples\Ex Integrating Gyro\Program.cs

member.name: M:MRI_Core_Library.IntegratingGyro.#ctor(MRI_Core_Library.CoreDeviceInterface)
member.summary:
Initializes an Integrating Gyro on a Core Device Interface. Port does not matter.
This method assumes the gyro has the factory default address of 0x20

member.name: M:MRI_Core_Library.IntegratingGyro.#ctor(System.Byte,MRI_Core_Library.CoreDeviceInterface)
member.summary: Initializes an Integrating Gyro on a Core Device Interface with a non-default address. Port does not matter.

member.name: T:MRI_Core_Library.IntegratingGyro.command
member.summary: Commands for the gyro.

member.name: F:MRI_Core_Library.IntegratingGyro.command.normalMeasurementMode
member.summary: Normal Oporation

member.name: F:MRI_Core_Library.IntegratingGyro.command.nullGyroOffsetAndResetZintegrator
member.summary: The sensor must be kept still for 3 seconds while the sensor calibrates. Once the gyro offset has been measured, the Z axis integrator will be reset to 0 and the command location will reset to normalMEasurementMode. The Z axis offset field is used to record the offset value and will be automatically recorded in EEPROM.

member.name: F:MRI_Core_Library.IntegratingGyro.command.resetZaxisIntegrator
member.summary: The tree fields X, Y and Z are the unprocessed values being obtained from the sensorelement. These values are updated at approximately 760Hz.

member.name: F:MRI_Core_Library.IntegratingGyro.command.WriteRRPROMdata
member.summary: Used to save offset and coefficient

member.name: M:MRI_Core_Library.IntegratingGyro.setCommand(MRI_Core_Library.IntegratingGyro.command)
member.summary: See command enum

member.name: M:MRI_Core_Library.IntegratingGyro.heading
member.summary: The heading data is obtained by dividing the integrated gyro Z value by 360 yielding a remainder which is then forced to lie between 0 - 359 as the current heading value. If rotated in a CW direction, the value increases from 0. If rotated in a CCW direction, the value decreases from 359.

member.name: M:MRI_Core_Library.IntegratingGyro.integratedZ
member.summary: The integrated gyro Z value returns the current value obtained by integrating the Z axis rate value, adjusted by the Z axis offset continuously. This integrated value can be reset to 0 by issuing command resetZaxisIntegrator. This value can also be used as a signed heading value where CW is in the positive direction and CCW is in the negative direction.

member.name: M:MRI_Core_Library.IntegratingGyro.rawX
member.summary: Rate of rotation

member.name: M:MRI_Core_Library.IntegratingGyro.rawY
member.summary: Rate of rotation

member.name: M:MRI_Core_Library.IntegratingGyro.rawZ
member.summary: Rate of rotation

member.name: M:MRI_Core_Library.IntegratingGyro.getZAxisOffset
member.summary: See setZAxisOffset();

member.name: M:MRI_Core_Library.IntegratingGyro.setZAxisOffset(System.Int32)
member.summary: Offset of z integrator

member.name: T:MRI_Core_Library.CoreControlModule
member.summary:
A general Core Control Module and related static functions.
Go to Core Control Modules Page

member.name: T:MRI_Core_Library.CoreControlModule.moduleType
member.summary: Register of Core Control Modules and their ID number. Used in getModuleType()

member.name: F:MRI_Core_Library.CoreControlModule.moduleType.Unknown_Core_Control_Module
member.summary: Default. May mean the motor or servo controller is not powered on.

member.name: M:MRI_Core_Library.CoreControlModule.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary:
Core Control Module Constructor
If you do not know the COM port or Serial Number, use Core_Control_Module.printConnectedDevices() or Core Device Discovery.

member.name: M:MRI_Core_Library.CoreControlModule.getComPort
member.summary: Gets the COM port

member.name: M:MRI_Core_Library.CoreControlModule.getSerialNumber
member.summary: Returns the serial number

member.name: M:MRI_Core_Library.CoreControlModule.getFirmwareVersion
member.summary: Returns the firmware version

member.name: M:MRI_Core_Library.CoreControlModule.information
member.summary: Returns a string of information about this controller.

member.name: M:MRI_Core_Library.CoreControlModule.getModuleType
member.summary: Get the type of this module.

member.name: M:MRI_Core_Library.CoreControlModule.findConnectedDevices
member.summary: Scan serial ports and get the device type and version for Core Control Modules. Servo and Motor controllers must be powered through their power input. Any modules already in use with open connections will appear as non-Modern Robotics devices.
member.returns: COM port, Serial Number, Device Type, Version number of the device if known.

member.name: M:MRI_Core_Library.CoreControlModule.printConnectedDevices
member.summary:
This method prints to the Console (1) The number of serial ports found (2) The COM port for each (3) The Serial Number for each device (4) The type of Core Control Module or "unknown" (5) The firmware version (6) About/Help
Any modules already in use with open connections will appear as non-Modern Robotics devices.

code.source: I:\Visual Studio\Projects\MRI Core Library Examples\Ex Scan For Modules\Program.cs

member.summary: Sets Default Values

member.summary: Listener for received serial data

member.name: M:MRI_Core_Library.CoreControlModule.openConnection
member.summary: Opens serial connection

member.name: M:MRI_Core_Library.CoreControlModule.closeConnection
member.summary: Closes serial connection

member.name: M:MRI_Core_Library.CoreControlModule.setLatencyTimer(System.Int32)
member.summary:
Optimizes serial communication by setting the latency timer of the FTDI chip.
Default is usually 16. 1 gives the fastest results.
This function is called automatically to set the Latency Timer to 1 when the connection is opened. This method will only work if the program has administrator privileges.

member.name: M:MRI_Core_Library.CoreControlModule.getLatencyTimer
member.summary:
Returns the latency timer of the FTDI chip.
Default is usually 16. 1 gives the fastest results.

member.param: Memory map location to begin write from
